name: DatePicker

aliases.name: Settings
aliases.comment: The type of date picker settings.
aliases.type: { placeholder : String , classNamespace : String , inputClassList : List ( String, Bool ) , inputName : Maybe.Maybe String , inputId : Maybe.Maybe String , inputAttributes : List (Html.Attribute DatePicker.Msg) , isDisabled : Date.Date -> Bool , parser : String -> Result.Result String Date.Date , dateFormatter : Date.Date -> String , dayFormatter : Date.Day -> String , monthFormatter : Date.Month -> String , yearFormatter : Int -> String , cellFormatter : String -> Html.Html DatePicker.Msg , firstDayOfWeek : Date.Day , changeYear : DatePicker.Date.YearRange }

types.name: DateEvent
types.comment:
A sugaring of `Maybe` to explicitly tell you how to interpret `Changed Nothing`, because `Just Nothing` seems somehow wrong.
    Used to represent a request, by the datepicker, to change the selected date.

types.name: DatePicker
types.comment: The DatePicker model. Opaque, hence no field docs.

types.name: Msg
types.comment: An opaque type representing messages that are passed inside the DatePicker.

values.name: between
values.comment:
Select a range of date to display


    DatePicker.init { defaultSettings | changeYear = between 1555 2018 }

values.name: defaultSettings
from
values.comment:
Select a range from a given year to this year


    DatePicker.init { defaultSettings | changeYear = from 1995 }

values.name: init
values.comment:
The default initial state of the Datepicker.  You must execute
the returned command (which, for the curious, sets the current date)
for the date picker to behave correctly.

    init =
      let
         (datePicker, datePickerFx) =
           DatePicker.init
      in
         { picker = datePicker } ! [ Cmd.map ToDatePicker datePickerfx ]

values.name: initFromDate
values.comment:
Initialize a DatePicker with a given Date


    init date =
      { picker = DatePicker.initFromDate date } ! [ ]

values.name: isOpen
values.comment: Expose if the datepicker is open

values.name: moreOrLess
values.comment:
Select a symmetric range of date to display


    DatePicker.init { defaultSettings | changeYear = moreOrLess 10 }

values.name: off
values.comment:
Turn off the date range


    DatePicker.init { defaultSettings | changeYear = off }

values.name: pick
values.comment:
Generate a message that will act as if the user has chosen a certain date,
    so you can call `update` on the model yourself.
    Note that this is different from just changing the "current chosen" date,
    since the picker doesn't actually have internal state for that.
    Rather, it will:
        * change the calendar focus
        * replace the input text with the new value
        * close the picker

    update datepickerSettings (pick (Just someDate)) datepicker

values.name: to
values.comment:
Select a range from this year to a given year


    DatePicker.init { defaultSettings | changeYear = to 2020 }

values.name: update
values.comment:
The date picker update function. The third tuple member represents a user action to change the
    date.
values.type: DatePicker.Settings -> DatePicker.Msg -> DatePicker.DatePicker -> ( DatePicker.DatePicker , Platform.Cmd.Cmd DatePicker.Msg , DatePicker.DateEvent )

values.name: view
values.comment: The date picker view. The Date passed is whatever date it should treat as selected.
values.type: Maybe.Maybe Date.Date -> DatePicker.Settings -> DatePicker.DatePicker -> Html.Html DatePicker.Msg
